basic_moves.trigger: You try to convince another character of some need or truth.
basic_moves.full_success:
The target is completely convinced, seeing the world as you do.
Share a relevant one of your Visions with the target at Level 2.
If you do not have the relevant Vision, give the target a new Vision at level 1.
basic_moves.partial_success:
The target gains the Vision, but (Pick Two):
* It's altered in some important way
* The news is distressing, give them 2 grief
* The target gives you a new level 1 Vision of their choice. 
* You need to provide concrete proof to bolster your argument.
basic_moves.name: Convincement

basic_moves.trigger: You help someone else towards achieving their goal.
basic_moves.full_success: GIve the target +1 Forward to their next attempt to realize a Vision. If you both share the same Vision, they take +2 instead.
basic_moves.partial_success:
The target gains +1 Forward to their next attempt tor realize that Vision, but (Pick One):
* You take 1d4 Grief to one of your Visions
* The GM chooses a relevant Vision of theirs for you to take on at level 1
* They take 1d4 Grief
basic_moves.name: Aid

basic_moves.trigger: You question your assumptions while examining any information you have on hand.
basic_moves.full_success:
You May (Pick Two):
* Suspend a Vision (Turn it over, it no longer affects this session)
* Reintroduce a Vision you had previously suspended
* Create a level-1 Vision
basic_moves.partial_success:
Pick one from the list above, AND (pick two):
* Take 1d4 Grief damage to a Vision
* Spend a piece of Evidence (can use multiple times)
* The GM gives you a level-1 Vision
basic_moves.name: Synthesize

basic_moves.trigger: You try to understand another person's Vision well enough to follow it yourself.
basic_moves.full_success: Gain a level 1 copy of another player's Vision.
basic_moves.partial_success:
Same as above BUT (pick two):
* The Vision is level 0
* Take 1d4 Grief damage to a Vision
* The Vision is altered in some key way
basic_moves.name: Empathize

basic_moves.trigger: You work towards a goal despite opposition.
basic_moves.full_success:
You succeed wildly. 
Mark progress on the relevant Vision and you may deal 1d4 Grief to a target who opposed you.
basic_moves.partial_success:
You succeed, but at a cost (Pick Two):
* One of your Visions is set back (take 1d4 Grief damage to the relevant Vision).
* You advance the Vision of someone or something you oppose.
* Your results are not quite what you intended (reduced effect).
basic_moves.name: Strive

basic_moves.trigger: You stand in opposition to a force trying to realize some Vision.
basic_moves.full_success:
You succeed in your opposition. Pick 2:
* You deal 1d4 Grief.
* You gain a level-1 Vision reflecting your opposition.
* Gain 1 Hold. You may spend this to prevent an attempt to realize the opposed Vision.
basic_moves.partial_success:
You achieve your results, but at a cost. Pick one from the above list, AND (pick one):
* You experience a frustrating setback. Take 1d4 Grief.
* The GM gives you a level-0 Vision reflecting your opposition.
basic_moves.name: Resistance

basic_moves.trigger: You examine your immediate surroundings, looking for new information.
basic_moves.full_success:
Ask three questions from the following list. 
* What here can best help me achieve [specific vision]?
* What here is the greatest threat to [specific vision]?
* What here is worth taking with me?
* What just happened here?
* What will happen here soon?
* Who or what owns this?
* What am I ignoring that I shouldn't be?

In addition, you may either create 1 new level-1 Vision or take +1 Forward relating to the information at hand.
basic_moves.partial_success:
Same as above BUT (Pick two):
* The answer to one of the questions is disheartening. Take 1d4 Grief.
* Evidence is sparse. You can only ask one of the questions.
* You are distracted by something immediately pressing. Create a new level-1 Vision.
basic_moves.name: Explore

basic_moves.trigger: Whenever you gain a Vision and you already have 3 Visions.
basic_moves.full_success:
The Vision aligns perfectly with your understanding of the world. Pick One:
* Increase or decrease the level of the Vision by one without cost. If a Vision is decreased below 0, it is discarded.
* Gain 1 Hold, you may spend this to negate one instance of Grief damage to this Vision.
basic_moves.partial_success:
You manage to understand the vision, but there is some consequence. Pick one:
* This Vision challenges your existing beliefs: Take 1d4 Grief.
* This Vision makes you forget something important: suspend one Vision until the end of the session.
* The new Vision is fundamentally twisted. Some other player changes one word in the Vision description.
basic_moves.name: Care
basic_moves.primary_stat: 5+ The higher of Explore or Socialize, - Your current Vision count
